---
# https://forum.posit.co/t/when-to-use-yaml-vs-when-to-use-setup-code-chunk/56169/
title: "`r params$doc_title`"
author: "MHKim"
date: "`r Sys.setlocale('LC_ALL', 'en_US.utf8'); format(Sys.time(), '%B %d, %Y')`"
output:
  html_notebook:  
    toc: yes
    toc_depth: 6
    toc_float:
      collapsed: false
      smooth_scroll: false
    number_sections: false
    code_folding: none
    df_print: tibble
    highlight: textmate
    fig_width: 10
    fig_height: 6
  html_document:
    toc: yes
    toc_depth: 6
    toc_float:
      collapsed: false
      smooth_scroll: false
    number_sections: false
    df_print: tibble
    code_folding: none
    highlight: textmate
    fig_width: 10
    fig_height: 6
  pdf_document: 
    toc: yes
    toc_depth: 6
    fig_width: 10
    fig_height: 6
    latex_engine: xelatex  # mainfont, sansfont, monofont, mathfont works only with xelatex and lualatex, but not pdflatex
    keep_tex: true
  word_document:
    toc: yes
    toc_depth: 6
    fig_width: 9
    fig_height: 6
# documentclass: scrartcl  # https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#variables-for-latex
# classoption: fontsize=9pt 
geometry: portrait, a3paper, margin=20mm # https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/pdf-document.html#latex-options
# fontsize: 12pt
header-includes: 
  - \usepackage{fontspec}
  - \newcommand{\setfallbackfont}[4]{
      \IfFontExistsTF{#2}
        {#1{#2}}
        {\IfFontExistsTF{#3}
          {#1{#3}}
          {#1{#4}}}}
  # - \setfallbackfont{\setmainfont}{Roboto Condensed}{Noto Sans Condensed}{Arial Narrow}
  # - \setfallbackfont{\setsansfont}{Roboto Condensed}{Noto Sans Condensed}{Arial Narrow}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setmainfont}{Roboto}{Noto Sans}{Arial}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setsansfont}{Roboto}{Noto Sans}{Arial}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setmonofont}{Cascadia Code SemiBold}{Cascadia Code}{Fira Code}
  - \usepackage[hangul]{kotex}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setmainhangulfont}{NanumGothic}{HCR Dotum LVT}{Malgun Gothic}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setsanshangulfont}{NanumGothic}{HCR Dotum LVT}{Malgun Gothic}
  - \setfallbackfont{\setmonohangulfont}{D2Coding}{NanumGothicCoding}{NanumGothic}

  doc_title: !r basename(rstudioapi::getSourceEditorContext()$path)

## calculate_mutual_information = function() -dev ----  
```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)


# Simulated data
set.seed(123)
X <- sample(1:3, 100, replace = TRUE)  # Variable X
Y <- sample(1:3, 100, replace = TRUE)  # Variable Y

# Step 1: Create contingency table (joint frequencies)
joint_table <- table(X, Y)

# Step 2: Calculate joint probabilities P(X, Y)
joint_prob <- prop.table(joint_table)

# Step 3: Calculate marginal probabilities P(X) and P(Y)
px <- rowSums(joint_prob)  # Marginal probability for X
py <- colSums(joint_prob)  # Marginal probability for Y

# Step 4: Compute MI
mi <- 0
for (i in seq_along(px)) {
  for (j in seq_along(py)) {
    if (joint_prob[i, j] > 0) {  # Avoid log(0)
      mi <- mi + joint_prob[i, j] * log(joint_prob[i, j] / (px[i] * py[j]))
    }
  }
}

# Convert to base 2 (optional)
mi <- mi / log(2)

# Print MI
print(mi)
```

## calculate_mutual_information = function(X, Y, base = exp(1)) ----  
```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_mutual_information <- function(X, Y, base = exp(1)) {
  # Ensure X and Y are factors for proper handling
  X <- as.factor(X)
  Y <- as.factor(Y)
  
  # Step 1: Create contingency table (joint frequencies)
  joint_table <- table(X, Y)
  
  # Step 2: Calculate joint probabilities P(X, Y)
  joint_prob <- prop.table(joint_table)
  
  # Step 3: Calculate marginal probabilities P(X) and P(Y)
  px <- rowSums(joint_prob)  # Marginal probability for X
  py <- colSums(joint_prob)  # Marginal probability for Y
  
  # Step 4: Compute Mutual Information
  mi <- 0
  for (i in seq_along(px)) {
    for (j in seq_along(py)) {
      if (joint_prob[i, j] > 0) {  # Avoid log(0)
        mi <- mi + joint_prob[i, j] * log(joint_prob[i, j] / (px[i] * py[j]), base)
      }
    }
  }
  
  # Return MI
  return(mi)
}
# Simulated data
set.seed(123)
X <- sample(1:3, 100, replace = TRUE)  # Variable X
Y <- sample(1:3, 100, replace = TRUE)  # Variable Y

# Calculate Mutual Information
mi_result <- calculate_mutual_information(X, Y, base = 2)  # Base 2 for bits
print(mi_result)

```
  
  
## calculate_mutual_information = function(X, Y, base = exp(1)) ----  
```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_mutual_information <- function(X, Y, base = exp(1)) {
  # Ensure X and Y are factors
  X <- as.factor(X)
  Y <- as.factor(Y)
  
  # Create contingency table (joint frequencies)
  joint_table <- table(X, Y)
  
  # Calculate joint probabilities P(X, Y)
  joint_prob <- prop.table(joint_table)
  
  # Calculate marginal probabilities P(X) and P(Y)
  px <- rowSums(joint_prob)
  py <- colSums(joint_prob)
  
  # Compute Expected Joint Probabilities P(X) * P(Y)
  expected_joint_prob <- outer(px, py)
  
  # Flatten matrices to vectors
  joint_prob_vector <- as.vector(joint_prob)
  expected_prob_vector <- as.vector(expected_joint_prob)
  
  # Indices where joint probabilities are greater than zero
  non_zero_indices <- joint_prob_vector > 0
  
  # Compute Mutual Information using vectorized operations
  mi_elements <- joint_prob_vector[non_zero_indices] * 
                 log(joint_prob_vector[non_zero_indices] / expected_prob_vector[non_zero_indices], base)
  
  # Sum up the mutual information contributions
  mi <- sum(mi_elements)
  
  # Return Mutual Information
  return(mi)
}


cat("    ________________________________________________________________________    \n")
cat("    %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%    \n")

Y <- sample(LETTERS[1:3], 100, replace = TRUE)


# Calculate Mutual Information

# Simulated continuous data
set.seed(123)
X_cont <- rnorm(100)
Y_cont <- X_cont^2 + rnorm(100, sd = 0.5)

# Discretize continuous variables into bins
bins <- 5  # Adjust the number of bins as needed
X_disc <- cut(X_cont, breaks = bins, labels = FALSE)
Y_disc <- cut(Y_cont, breaks = bins, labels = FALSE)

# Calculate Mutual Information
mi_continuous <- calculate_mutual_information(X_disc, Y_disc, base = 2)
print(paste("Mutual Information (bits):", mi_continuous))

cat("    %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%    \n")
set.seed(123)
# Independent variables
X_indep <- sample(1:4, 1000, replace = TRUE)
Y_indep <- sample(1:4, 1000, replace = TRUE)

mi_indep <- calculate_mutual_information(X_indep, Y_indep)
print(paste("MI for independent variables:", mi_indep))

cat("    %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%    \n")
# Perfect dependency
set.seed(123)
X_dep <- sample(1:4, 1000, replace = TRUE)
Y_dep <- X_dep  # Y is exactly the same as X

mi_dep <- calculate_mutual_information(X_dep, Y_dep)
print(paste("MI for perfectly dependent variables:", mi_dep))
```

## calculate_entropy <- function(X, base = exp(1)) ----  
```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_entropy <- function(X, base = exp(1)) {
  # Ensure X is a factor for categorical data
  X <- as.factor(X)
  
  # Step 1: Calculate probabilities P(X)
  prob <- prop.table(table(X))
  
  # Step 2: Compute entropy
  entropy <- -sum(prob * log(prob, base), na.rm = TRUE)
  
  # Return the entropy
  return(entropy)
}
# Simulated data
set.seed(123)
X <- sample(LETTERS[1:3], 100, replace = TRUE)

# Calculate Entropy
entropy_result <- calculate_entropy(X, base = 2)  # Base 2 for bits
print(paste("Entropy (bits):", entropy_result))

cat("    %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%    \n")
# Perfect dependency
set.seed(123)
X_dep <- sample(1:4, 1000, replace = TRUE)
Y_dep <- X_dep  # Y is exactly the same as X

# Calculate Entropy
entropy_result <- calculate_entropy(X_dep, base = 2)  # Base 2 for bits
print(paste("Entropy (bits):", entropy_result))
# Calculate Entropy
entropy_result <- calculate_entropy(X_dep, base = exp(1))  
print(paste("Entropy (e):", entropy_result))
mi_dep <- calculate_mutual_information(X_dep, Y_dep)
print(paste("MI for perfectly dependent variables:", mi_dep))

```

```{r writeRDS-EvalNoEchoNoMsgNoResults, eval=TRUE, echo=FALSE, warning=TRUE, message=NA, results="hide"}
# __________|------  
## @ write_rds( get(.objectname), paste0(.path4write,ifelse(.path4write=="","","/"),.objectname,".rds",".xz"), compress = "xz", compression = 9L) |> system.time() |> round(3) |> unclass() |> deparse() |> cat("\n")
.path4write = .path4write %>% str_replace(fixed(env1$path$path1), "") %>% str_replace("^/", "")  # [][Rproject] makes an error in git bash
if(exists("MetaData")) {
    # MetaData$DataSetNames |> names() |> paste0(collapse = "\n") |> cat("\n", sep="")
    cat("    ________________________________________________________________________    \n")
if(exists("MetaData")) {
    # MetaData$DataSetNames |> names() |> paste0(collapse = "\n") |> cat("\n", sep="")
    cat("    ________________________________________________________________________    \n")
    for (DataSetName in names(MetaData$DataSetNames)) {    
        if(exists(DataSetName)) {
            assign(DataSetName, structure(get(DataSetName, envir = .GlobalEnv), MetaData = as.environment(MetaData)), envir = .GlobalEnv)
            if(is.null(attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName)) attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName = DataSetName
            if(attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName != DataSetName) attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName = DataSetName
            if (!is.null(attributes(attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName)$.path_file)) {
                message( "attributes(attributes(",DataSetName,")$DataSetName)$.path_file == ",deparse(attributes(attributes(get(DataSetName))$DataSetName)$.path_file) )
                env1$f$f_objectname.size.write_rds.git_lfs_track_add_f(.objectname = DataSetName, .path_file = attributes(attributes(.GlobalEnv[[DataSetName]])$DataSetName)$.path_file, createBackup = FALSE, Execute = FALSE, path.size_files = TRUE, git_lfs_track = TRUE, git_add_f = TRUE)
            } else {
                env1$f$f_objectname.size.write_rds.git_lfs_track_add_f(.objectname = DataSetName, .path4write = .path4write, createBackup = FALSE, Execute = FALSE, path.size_files = TRUE, git_lfs_track = TRUE, git_add_f = TRUE)
            }
        } else {  message("!exists(",deparse(DataSetName),")")  }
        cat("    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    \n")
    }
}
}
```

```{r Render-NoEchoNoMsgNoResults, echo=FALSE, warning=TRUE, message=NA, results="hide"}
env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.pdf = env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.ext |> str_replace("\\.([[:alnum:]]+)$",".pdf") |> str_replace_all('[ <>()|\\:&;#?*\']', "-")
env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.html = env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.ext |> str_replace("\\.([[:alnum:]]+)$",".html") |> str_replace_all('[ <>()|\\:&;#?*\']', "-")
if (Sys.getenv("PARENT_RENDERING") != "YES") {
    if (Sys.info()["sysname"] == "Windows") {
        .tlmgr_installed_packages <- system2("tlmgr", args = c("info", "--list", "--only-installed"), stdout = TRUE)
        for (.font_name in c("roboto", "cascadia-code")) if(.tlmgr_installed_packages |> str_subset(.font_name) |> length() == 0) tinytex::tlmgr_install(.font_name)

        cat('Starting: rstudioapi::getSourceEditorContext()$path |> rmarkdown::render(output_dir = ',deparse(dirname(env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.ext)),', output_format = "pdf_document")  \n')
        Sys.setenv(PARENT_RENDERING = "YES"); env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.ext %>% {paste0(env1$path$path1,"/",.)} %>% {rmarkdown::render(input = .,output_dir = dirname(.), output_format = "pdf_document")}; Sys.setenv(PARENT_RENDERING = "NO")
        .path_file = env1$path$LastSourceEditorContext.path_filename.pdf %>% {paste0(env1$path$path1,"/",.)}
        env1$f$f_file.git_lfs_track_add_f(.path_file = .path_file, Execute = FALSE)
        env1$env.internal.attach$f_filename.ext.createBackup(backup_from_path_filename.ext = .path_file, .backup_to_path="-backup", timeFormat="%y%m%d_%H", overwrite=TRUE)
        try(env1$env.internal.attach$f_file_PDF.sumatra(.path_file))
    }
}
```
